column5: I love it when pier fishing for perch , and you catch a four inch perch and before you release it the fisherman next to you asks if he can have it.
good post!! Yesterday on a local lake... we were coming in from the softwater when some guy was fishing on shore... Standing right beside the NO FISHING sign ..lol too funny ... complete moron
No I wasn't aware of that, man I love this place because I learn something new everytime I log on.
Oh...if only it were true (*sigh*)...
I get a real kick out of guys when they see muddy water, say that the water is polluted and then when they see nice clear water, that it is not polluted.
apparently talking to me, fishing with me, knowing me or anything to do with me is not a good idea.   LOL!
"i have to go home for dinner"  just when the fish start biting

How about waiting in Q to get your boat out of the water and one of the fellows in the boat next to me:whistling:,says look at the #$%&^# you know what ,and because your voice carries over water,plus only idling,you could see everyone on the dock and other boats looking over.Just a tad embarrassing..After fishing of course.

thats actually a technique in carp fishing...lol  i call em blow ups... you can see bubble trails on the surface and see where the carp are feeding... then cast in the area they are feeding... it actually works...  the bubbles are coming from the rotting debris on the bottom...  im 100% serious...

Fishing Scugog for the first time on the Ceasarea side, trolling when I notice a boat approaching. Assumed it was MNR but it turns out to be a boat full of guys looking for some help.  They asked me if I knew where their launch was. I asked them if they launched from Ceasarea. They said no, but that they had launched at the marina. They couldn't even tell me what side of the lake they launched at, Port Perry or Ceasarea side.

I have a friends that always ask me to go fishing with them but their is always one guy ask as go let move to the other spot just becuase he is not catching fish and all of us catching and having fun... that really pissed me off... Can we go...?? come on  or sometimes he will throw his line and tangle up with and he would say, is ur line in there?? How stup can you be???  or even when you go river fishing and you said fish on!! always "some" idiot dont bother getting thier line out... and when you tangle ur line with them, omg you have fish... didnt I just said that?!! lolz
Here's the most Stupid thing I hear when i'm fishing with a buddy............is it time to LEAVE yet????
YES.......but we practice catch and release........

This one blows my mind.. Daily I see this..I need a job with the MNR when everyday I drive by the Grand river to see the guys lined up in a known walleye spot. Or when you go down for a walk with the dogs and some guy has a FAT waleye in his hands walking to his car...I get sick of calling the tips line and telling people that they are breaking the law..They truely dont care.  We will be lucky to have any walleye left in the river by opening day around here...
You got that right Buddy Boy......my rear roller is BARELY touching the water.......someday I will give all you C.C. a lesson on how to launch and retrieve a fishing boat.....
I don't mind.  I make sure they know that there definitely isn't, and that they tell all their friends.

Early spring trout fishing....I mean real early and very cold with rain and snow.  Fishing with a guy who makes fishing films for TV.  He insisted on using a fly rod and dry fly early in the morning and then late in the afternoon.  Would not go fishing at midday when there were a few flies.  Had the line coming out from behind the fly reel (line was spooled backwards too) and called himself a pro.  There were 4 of us and if I hadn't used a black Panther Martin, we would not have caught any fish.
Not as stupid as it is innocent... But when a new fisherman asks " how do you know when there's a fish bitin?"

I asked that once while bottom fishing in 400' of water off islamorada with 3#'s of weight on the line. I asked the captain "how the heck do you know when you have a bite with all this line out and weight?" His answer was simply "Oh, you'll know " He was right, darn near got yanked outta the boat!!!!!

I was fishing in Bobcaygon one time, up streem of the bridge (when you could still fish there) I hooked into a big carp using about 6# test line (wasn't fishing carp LOL). Anyway this carp decides to head down stream under the bridge. No problem, I had lots of line. This very nice little Asian guy comes over from the down stream side of the bridge and looks at me and says "we have conflict, you tangled up with my fish"! LOL. Seems the carp on my line had run down under the bridge, under his line, so he thought it should now be his fish. I solved it quuite easily, I just cut his line for him

And the guy who wants to go fishing with you , and how its very important that you don't ever go with out him , then once in the boat it starts , all the things he should of stayed home and done instead .
What exactly are you trying to imply here geoff?
" Cast over by those bubbles, there is a fish breathing over there!"
No, those are fish farts......didn't you know that?  S.
Guys on the Midland town dock using perch as bait for Pike. Told them they were now illegal, they said that in the regs it said perch could be used for bait.
"All you need to catch ___________, is ___________, but they aren't biting today."
All those clowns who think a 17 inch bass is a five pounder

Took a friend who is noob to fishing to the West Arm last summer. His mission was to catch big pike. He puts on a xrap, makes 15-20 casts, puts down his rod and says "you should of told me there is no fish here, this sucks". According to him, the fishing sucked all week as he was being outfished 10:1
The fine fellows that say "oh, you fish bass tournaments, that must be easy I catch bass all the time"
come on skeeter, you know fare well it was a joke as I haven't heard from nor seen you in a while.
It seems my timing is terrible.  I don’t know how many times I’ve heard "You should have been here yesterday!!  They were on FIRE!!"
you should have come with us yesterday to the lake, the crappies were on fire!

"i'd never eat perch caught downriver of the domtar paper mill in cornwall.... too much pollution in those perch..."  :wallbash:  :wallbash:  :wallbash:    do people not realize that most of ontario's moving water eventually flows through the st.lawrence... all the factories and pollution on all the great lakes and tribs all make it this way... and some people think the paper mill is the deal breaker...lol  oh well... no fish fry for you...lol
My buddys friends brother caught a 80 lbs musky.
^^ Makes me think of...  "a buddy of mine sent me a pic of the new WR Pike caught from Nipissing by a friend of his uncles neighbour just the other day"...
Dumbest product, bass pro a fish whacker! And for worms, worm food!
And i think one of them was wearing at least one glove
i hate armchair biologists that want to manage our lakes and rivers like put and take fish ponds instead functioning ecosystems.  and i've heard/seen too many stupid quotes to list them all.

Not something I've heard per say, just witnessed. Those who submerge their boat trailers so deep they spend gross amounts of time tying up the boat ramp trying to get the boat centered on the trailer.....

When I tell people I fish  during winter months, they all assume I only Ice fish, and why do I have to tolerate being cold outside. I have to tell them repeatedly that there are many creeks and river system that is fishable during winter months without having to just ice fish. To be a Canadian we have to embrace the winter outdoor.  Many also assume fishing is so boring, a waste of time and anglers do not do anything except to wait, they probably saw an older Popeye show where he tied his fishing line on his toe while taking a nap.  I tell these folks that the sport fishing industry in North america has a sale of more then 2 Billion dollars a year , more than Golf and Tennis sale combined.
Also the ever popular, back halfway down the ramp and start tying your lines. MOVE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Nothing wrong with disposing of fish or keeping your worms healthy to be honest.  Another one of mine, pulling your boat up half the ramp then getting out and putting on the tiedowns, etc.  Get out of the way so OTHER PEOPLE CAN USE THE RAMP!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

LOL....see this ALL THE TIME.....only the winch of the trailer can be seen above the water and the dumbass has waders on, even though there are docks on both side of his trailer....I guess some like to launch and retrieve trailers....LOL...  Then, since the boat is not on straight after they pull it out of the depths of the launch they re-launch the boat and do it again and again and again...
HAHAHAHA!  actions speak louder than words!!
Exactly!  You can spend all day trying to straighten it out on the trailer when the transom is floating high above the trailer, in, out, in, out, in, out......
You just want to throttle them Of course, that would never happen to Billy Bob, he doesnt even get his bearings wet.
If the boat's crocked on the trailer, give it a little push when it's out of the water.  Backing it down the ramp again trying to line it up is an exercise in futility.
"There are fish in Lake Ontario?! HH

The upside down spinning reel definitely gets me!  An annoyance that comes to mind is when I get a hit, or sometimes have even had the fish on for a few seconds, and my buddy tells me that it was weeds.  Honestly.  I'm a calm, patient guy.  But telling me that what I know was a fish, was really weeds?  That's called lighting the fuse
A nuisance line down niagara....  "Catch any dead bodies lately????"  I must hear it at least once a week Perhaps I should ask if they are volunteering
Floatfishing with " that guy" that thinks every time the float twitches or goes under it was a missed fish, even while fishing 4' of water with an 8' lead. Lol
And he sets the hook like a bull whip each time spooking the run.  I hear Ya JonP.
lol! So annoying!

Why i prefer to fish alone mostly, and in my own boat!  I fished with a guy who insisted on having fish I.D and alarm on at all times. We would sit on a spot marking bubbles and weeds without catching anything but he would refuse to move cuz "No...look...look at all the fish down there!"  And folks who dont understand that when you are on a lake that is 4 million square miles in size with only 2 boats on it, it is not cool to use my marker bouy as a point of reference causing our hulls to touch from time to time, without as much as a hello or tip of the hat.

" Pee in the water it attracts the fish" " Red Eyed Devil Bass" " Tie a 9v battery to the line , it changes the polarity and alkalinity in the water and you will out fish yourself 20:1" " fresh water Shark caught in Nipissing through the ice , happens every winter" "fill your boat with water , the aluminum will swell and the leaks will disappear" " Suckers are just like a Salmon they swim up river and die"  Randy
I did that all last season, but it wasnt a guy saying that, it was my wife. Mine in the bow was set normal, and she thought all the fish were around the back of the boat cause mine wasnt beeping.
buddies who catch a 20 inch 4 pound walleye and then try to tell me its bigger than my 27 inch 8 pounder
Guys telling me a 20 inch walleye is four pounds.
ouch

I'm not talking about jokes here, I mean things that just make you wonder how some people get through life alive, let alone fish while doing it. I suspect this list could be long.  A couple of years ago I was down at Frenchmans Bay, and witnessed some bonehead throwing stuff at one of the resident beavers as it swam by. I yelled at him to stop, and his reply stunned me; "What do you want to protect them for? They'll eat all the fish!"  Natural history FAIL.
Some guy asking me if he can keep a steelhead on the Notty standing about 5ft away from the No Kill sign.  Although I give him credit, at least he asked, lol.
delete
The people who think pike stop biting because they lose their teeth!!!
While ice fishing last year buddy told me he was going to vote for the decepticons so they can scrap the long gun registry.
That one is still going around?! I heard that over 40 years ago!
Not so much a saying, but more of an action.  I always get a kick out of the guys who use a spinning reel like a baitcaster.  They have the reel upside down, and turn it backwards to retrieve.

We were out filming a show with three boats on the water.  We took a break to eat lunch and grouped up togther as we drifted.  A boat comes flying by and we hear one of them say "hey look at those guys all bunched together, they must be killing them, lets go over there"  As they get within a long cast away we hear the buddy say,  "You idiot, they're eating"

THIS is the stupidest. Its one thing if a guy picks up a fishing rod, having never seen one used, but to stubbornly continue to fish that way, despite everyone else you've ever seen spin fishing?? From personal experience, I've determined that this upsidedown-style type of fishing stems from that the fact Dad used to fish that way, so thats the way Imma do it too!
I heard a couple of guys say  "stop here it shows a nice hole on the sonar." After being anchored for a bit the guy says " We must've drifted the hole is gone now"
But what if he's using it that way on a spiral wrapped rod? Would it be OK then?
I have no patience for any jackass that holds pike by the eye sockets, because that's how you hold them.

The first year I fished in Alaska we were fishing the Kenai just below Skilak Lake. We pulled into the drift and i was using a 15' float rod with my center pin and some red neck rube from Alabama or some other Southern state says to his buddy "He's using one of them thar spy rods!!!".   :rolleyes:
Agreed, that's brutal.  Or someone who has their fingers up the gill plates about to release a fish...
OOHHHH Geoffy I guess that means the last time you went with him, is the LAST time you go with him.
If only we had Green Coach Dog to help us with the hillybilly to English translation. Did he mean spay or fly when he said spy?
I can't stand when fishing show hosts just throw fish back in the water....I'd prefer to see a little more care (respect) when handling fish.

Neighbour at the cottage had some company up last summer and were having a hard time catching fish. They were after lakers and hadnt had a sniff. I point them to a sweet spot to help them salvage their day and have a bit of fun as there are some large pike that hold there.  Well, dont they come back with a 13lb gator! The visitors kid shows up later that day, the old man takes him out and they return with a 15lber OFF THE SAME SPOT!!!  The guy then has the nerve to slap me on the shoulder with a good ole " thanks for the honey hole! Youll have to show me your good spot next summer when we come back!"  The neighbour approached me after his guests left and apologized for pirating the spot, knowing im all for C+R. But im still vexed about it.  My contribution is me. Stupid people that dont know when to keep their mouths shut.
and here I thought you were going to comment on our outing "just one fish, even a perch" then fish on...
Everybody who doesn't fish who try to tell you how they saw someone catch a bass/perch/guppy that was "I kid you not" this big |---------------------------|  and they hold their arms out 3' a part.
He meant Spey. Spay is what you do to your dog or cat so's they cain't haves babies.
Lol. I didn't proof read what my phone was auto correcting. Not a lot of anglers at Android I guess.
My favorite is the guy anchored up with his fish alarm turned on and constantly beeping.

Returned to the dock with a limit of nice walleyes....guy on dock asked me how did you catch them....we were back trolling Rapalas....how do you do that.....we tie the line on the back hood of the Rapala...    Also those who think all the fish in the lake are theirs only....and get upset when you take some home to eat....
